DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Intubation Conditions Between the Gliderite and the S-Guide
DOC.detailed_description: Intubation with an unchanneled videolaryngoscope mandates the use of a stylet. The Gliderite is a stylet specially designed for videolaryngoscopes. The investigators aim to compare the efficacy of a new designed bougie for intubation in patients with simulated difficult airways. The primary endpoint will be time necessary for intubation, secondary endpoints will be injuries, ease of use and subjective assessment.
DOC.criteria: Surgery necessitating general anesthesia and orotracheal intubation History or criteria of difficult intubation Patient refusal
